item.description: Date: Thursday, October 23, 2025 (all day) - Students applying to the NSF GRFP are highly encouraged to seek review of your documents from the Fellowship Advisor. item.title: Dr. Azita Hirsa Receives the Rensselaer Alumni Association (RAA) Teaching Award
item.description: The Industrial and Systems Engineering Department proudly celebrates Dr. Azita Hirsa, recipient of the RAA Teaching Award. Dr. Hirsa’s courses in professional development, ethics, and management of engineering and technology inspire students to connect technical excellence with integrity, purpose, and collaboration. “Students learn best when they feel supported, challenged, and seen as collaborators in our learning journey,” said Dr. Hirsa. “This recognition affirms that those efforts matter.”

item.title: Artist Mary Mattingly Speaks on October 22
item.description: Artist Mary Mattingly will discuss her recent work with an emphasis on Swale, a mobile, community-led food access initiative that transforms NYC waterways into civic spaces for environmental and economic justice. Built on a repurposed barge, Swale serves communities where it remains illegal to forage on public land, providing free access to perennial fruits, herbs, and vegetables while educating the public on sustainable food systems and land rights. West Hall 113 or Webex on Oct. 22 at 6pm.

item.title: Webex vs Teams: Choosing the Right Tool for Your Campus Workflows | Oct. 24
item.description: The campus community has access to both Cisco Webex and Microsoft Teams, but which is best for your needs? Join us on Friday, October 24, 2025, 10-11:30am for a practical, fast-paced session comparing the strengths of each platform. Whether you’re teaching, hosting a symposium, collaborating on a grant proposal, or streamlining your team’s communication, we’ll help you match the right tool to the task. Register at https://rensselaer.webex.com/weblink/register/r4235dc39258dd1620e7365907d91af2d

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar – “Certifications & Skill Development in Percipio”
item.description: This course introduces the tools available in Percipio to support growth through certifications and skill benchmarks. You’ll learn how to identify relevant certifications and use benchmark assessments to measure current knowledge. Perfect for employees and supervisors alike, this session will help you navigate the platform’s upskilling features and align learning with career development objectives.
